page.title: 10Employment,Farming,Forestry
page.content: Although the main source of employment is agriculture, forestry also makes a substantial contribution to the local economy. People who live and work in the area are mainly self employed. Some farmers take advantage of te tourist influx by offering bed and breakfast accommodation and providing camp sites. The local vicar, headmaster and schoolteacher live in the village. Six people are employed in the leather business situated in the village and there is an antiques restoration enterprise. Those who work outside the area include 1 Merchant Seaman,1Record salesman, 1Bookmaker (Llandeilo & Llanelli) 2 council employees (Llandeilo) 1 music lecturer (London 1 tourist information officer (Llandovery)
